oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A survey of coccidia shedding among small ruminants on St. Kitts and the Appalachian region
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Roberson, J.
Mittleider, T.
Cameron-Blake, N.
Gibbons, P.
Cappello, B.
Ketzis, J.
Rohleder, S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: St. Kitts
Appalachian region
management practice
small ruminant producers
coccidia
shedding
sheep
goats
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A study was conducted on the island of St. Kitts to determine management practices and the issues of small ruminant producers. A disease survey was also conducted to determine disease presence. Fifty farms were studied at each location. This project was later repeated in the Appalachian region surrounding Harrogate, Tennessee. The objective of this abstract is to compare and contrast the shedding of coccidia in sheep and goats by age group by site.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2020; 397
